summary: Este es el futuro de Tony Stark luego de 'Avengers: Endgame'
title: Este es el futuro de Tony Stark luego de 'Avengers: Endgame'
body:
Este es el futuro de Tony Stark luego de ‘Avengers: Endgame’

¿Volveremos a verlo en el Universo Cinematográfico de Marvel?

Sabemos cual fue el destino final del personaje interpretado por Robert Downey Jr. en la que se está convirtiendo en la película más taquillera de todos los tiempos.

Sin embargo, muchos fans tienen la esperanza de volver a ver a Tony Stark de alguna forma en las cintas de Marvel Studios. Incluso a quienes rumoran que se convertirá en…

blog.name: ballyhoobarnes
blog.description:
karina ☻

18+ content

{masterlist} | {buy me a coffee!}

title: The Neighbour — Part One
body:
Abstract: You decide to host a little girls night party with lots and lots of wine. By three in the morning you’re drunk enough to be able to joke about the small crush you have on Steve with your best friend, Wanda. Continuing to entertain the both of you, you write a mock text to him in your drunken state not intending to ever send it to him.

Pairing: Neighbour!Steve Rogers x reader

Word Count: 1,103 words

Warnings: drinking, fluffly cuteness

A/N: eeeep this is the first part I hope you guys enjoy!!! xx

“Isn’t it a little too early to start drinking?” Steve chuckled as he passed by you to get to his adjacent apartment. You playfully rolled you eyes, unlocking your front door. “Ha, ha.” You laughed unenthusiastically, although it was fully playful. “It’s for tonight,” you informed him as Steve looked up from the mail in his hands. 

“Ooh, a party?” Steve said, wiggling his eyebrows in the air and crossing his arms over his incredibly toned chest. “Actually, yes.” You said making Steve blow a breath of air through his nose. “Since when does [Y/N] party?” Steve teased as you just rolled your eyes in fake annoyance.

“Just for that, you’re not invited.” You said, sticking your tongue out playfully. Steve feigned hurt, “how dare you?” You couldn’t help but laugh, Steve just had a certain charm surrounding him and it was impossible to be anything but happy around him. 

“Sorry,” you shrugged, kicking the door open, “girls only.” You winked before shutting the door. You sighed once you were inside, looking around the empty apartment that you had once shared with who you thought was the love of your life. Sighing, you toed your shoes off and walked into the slightly less empty kitchen.

You wish you could say that it was a mutual and mature breakup, but that’s the furthest from what actually happened. You’d caught him cheating with his secretary. Although he was the one stupid enough to do it in your shared apartment. You ended it in seconds, kicking the both of them out.

You’d dedicated four years of your life to him and now you were starting all over. 

Or at least that’s what you were trying to do. 

You shook your thoughts out of your head and decided to distract yourself for the girls night you had planned instead. It wasn’t going to be a huge party, just your closest friends and few school and work friends having a good time. 

And no boys allowed. 

You had just finished putting all the alcohol and snacks away when you heard a knock at your door. You couldn’t help but smile, knowing it was most likely Steve. 

“How may I assist you?” You said as you swung the door open to reveal Steve standing there, huge grin on his lips. “Got any laundry detergent I could borrow?” He asked, cheeky smile never leaving his face. 

You crossed your arms over your chest and furrowed your eyebrows in confusion. “I thought you did laundry on Sunday’s” you thought aloud. “And today’s Friday.” You tried your best to stop the smile that was threatening to break out on your lips. 

“Alright, ya caught me,” Steve chuckled, putting his hands up to signal defeat. You snorted, turning on your heels to walk back towards your kitchen knowing that Steve would follow. “What do you really want, Rogers?” You asked, not even looking back at him. 

“What? I can’t hang out with my neighbour?” Steve said as convincingly as possible but you gave him that look that told him you saw right through him. “Fine,” he sighed, “just wanted to see if I could get an invite for tonight.” He smirked as he followed you through your apartment. 

“There’s a very strict no boys allowed policy,” you said, shrugging your shoulders. “Fine, but I’m taking you out for drinks soon, okay?” Steve said, pointing a finger at you until you agreed. 

“Whatever you say, Rogers.” You laughed as Steve left, leaving you feeling like you always did after talking to him. 

Flushed. 

Embarrassed. 

And slightly aroused. 

Steve was one of your closest friends, and he had been there for all the ups and downs in your relationship. He was also the first person who had raced over at three in the morning with ice cream and tissues to comfort you. 

You’d always thought that Steve was attractive, well, that was a given, but you’d always felt as if there was a connection with him. You loved him as a friend, but your heart always dropped a little when he mentioned his latest hookups or when you saw what pretty girl would be walking out of his place. 

But you couldn’t think about Steve anymore, it was almost party time and you had lots to do and very little time to do it in.

You didn’t know if it was the wine or the tequila, but you had ended up on the floor laughing as Wanda sat on the couch laughing with her head thrown back. It must’ve been about three in the morning and everyone else had left except her. 

“I think we need to discuss your dreamy neighbour, Shteve,” Wanda smirked as a blush tined your cheeks. “Oh you love him!” Wanda squealed as you furrowed your eyebrows “I do not,” you tried to say adamantly but Wanda saw right through you. 

“Oh so you wouldn’t mind him going out with someone tonight?” She smirked. “What, with who? Oh I bet it’s that pretty blonde on the third floor, I knew they had a thing for each other.” You grumbled only making Wanda laugh harder. 

“See.” She said matter-of-factly as you just rolled your eyes. “Okay fine, I like him.” You said as she just hummed. “Why won’t you just ask him out?” She said, grabbing a pillow and placing it on her lap as you made your way up onto the couch. 

You snorted at her words, “maybe because he doesn’t like me.” You said, raising an eyebrow only making Wanda roll her eyes at you. “He so does, I can see it.” She stated and this time it was your turn to roll your eyes. 

“Oh totally, let me just text him right now.” You giggled in your drunken state as Wanda snickered. You grabbed your phone for emphasis, pulling up Steve’s name in your phone. 

“Dear Steve,” you began as Wanda covered her mouth with her hand to hold her laughter back. “I think you’re cute and pretty and funny.” You continued, entertaining yourself. “Let’s go out on a date, maybe to the park or even a museum.” You added for theatrics as Wanda laughed. 

“Yours truly, your friendly neighbour [Y/N].” You finished off, throwing your hands up in victory. “Is that what you want me to do Wanda?” You asked as she just looked at you. 

“C’mon, it’s getting late, we should get to bed,” you said before shoving your phone in your back pocket forgetting it was even there as you and Wanda made your way to your room, fully expecting to be hungover in the morning. 

TAGLIST (OPEN): 

@nerdgirljen, @harryngtonewithyourshit, @just-in-case-iloveyou, @stevehesaidabadlanguageword, @cant-decide-at-this-moment, @srgntjbbarness, @aucontrerasv, @california-grown, @potteryourotter, @treacheroussparks 

Send me a message if you would like to be added/removed!

If you enjoy my work, consider buying me a coffee (:

And slightly aroused.

You’d always thought that Steve was attractive, well, that was a given, but you’d always felt as if there was a connection with him. You loved him as a friend, but your heart always dropped a little when he mentioned his latest hookups or when you saw what pretty girl would be walking out of his place. 

But you couldn’t think about Steve anymore, it was almost party time and you had lots to do and very little time to do it in.

You didn’t know if it was the wine or the tequila, but you had ended up on the floor laughing as Wanda sat on the couch laughing with her head thrown back. It must’ve been about three in the morning and everyone else had left except her. 

“I think we need to discuss your dreamy neighbour, Shteve,” Wanda smirked as a blush tined your cheeks. “Oh you love him!” Wanda squealed as you furrowed your eyebrows “I do not,” you tried to say adamantly but Wanda saw right through you. 

“Oh so you wouldn’t mind him going out with someone tonight?” She smirked. “What, with who? Oh I bet it’s that pretty blonde on the third floor, I knew they had a thing for each other.” You grumbled only making Wanda laugh harder. 

“See.” She said matter-of-factly as you just rolled your eyes. “Okay fine, I like him.” You said as she just hummed. “Why won’t you just ask him out?” She said, grabbing a pillow and placing it on her lap as you made your way up onto the couch. 

You snorted at her words, “maybe because he doesn’t like me.” You said, raising an eyebrow only making Wanda roll her eyes at you. “He so does, I can see it.” She stated and this time it was your turn to roll your eyes. 

“Oh totally, let me just text him right now.” You giggled in your drunken state as Wanda snickered. You grabbed your phone for emphasis, pulling up Steve’s name in your phone. 

“Dear Steve,” you began as Wanda covered her mouth with her hand to hold her laughter back. “I think you’re cute and pretty and funny.” You continued, entertaining yourself. “Let’s go out on a date, maybe to the park or even a museum.” You added for theatrics as Wanda laughed. 

“Yours truly, your friendly neighbour [Y/N].” You finished off, throwing your hands up in victory. “Is that what you want me to do Wanda?” You asked as she just looked at you. 

“C’mon, it’s getting late, we should get to bed,” you said before shoving your phone in your back pocket forgetting it was even there as you and Wanda made your way to your room, fully expecting to be hungover in the morning. 

TAGLIST (OPEN): 

@nerdgirljen, @harryngtonewithyourshit, @just-in-case-iloveyou, @stevehesaidabadlanguageword, @cant-decide-at-this-moment, @srgntjbbarness, @aucontrerasv, @california-grown, @potteryourotter, @treacheroussparks 

Send me a message if you would like to be added/removed!

If you enjoy my work, consider buying me a coffee (:

trail.content_raw:
Abstract: You decide to host a little girls night party with lots and lots of wine. By three in the morning you’re drunk enough to be able to joke about the small crush you have on Steve with your best friend, Wanda. Continuing to entertain the both of you, you write a mock text to him in your drunken state not intending to ever send it to him.

Pairing: Neighbour!Steve Rogers x reader

Word Count: 1,103 words

Warnings: drinking, fluffly cuteness

A/N: eeeep this is the first part I hope you guys enjoy!!! xx

“Isn’t it a little too early to start drinking?” Steve chuckled as he passed by you to get to his adjacent apartment. You playfully rolled you eyes, unlocking your front door. “Ha, ha.” You laughed unenthusiastically, although it was fully playful. “It’s for tonight,” you informed him as Steve looked up from the mail in his hands. 

“Ooh, a party?” Steve said, wiggling his eyebrows in the air and crossing his arms over his incredibly toned chest. “Actually, yes.” You said making Steve blow a breath of air through his nose. “Since when does [Y/N] party?” Steve teased as you just rolled your eyes in fake annoyance.

“Just for that, you’re not invited.” You said, sticking your tongue out playfully. Steve feigned hurt, “how dare you?” You couldn’t help but laugh, Steve just had a certain charm surrounding him and it was impossible to be anything but happy around him. 

“Sorry,” you shrugged, kicking the door open, “girls only.” You winked before shutting the door. You sighed once you were inside, looking around the empty apartment that you had once shared with who you thought was the love of your life. Sighing, you toed your shoes off and walked into the slightly less empty kitchen.

[[MORE]]

You wish you could say that it was a mutual and mature breakup, but that’s the furthest from what actually happened. You’d caught him cheating with his secretary. Although he was the one stupid enough to do it in your shared apartment. You ended it in seconds, kicking the both of them out.

You’d dedicated four years of your life to him and now you were starting all over. 

Or at least that’s what you were trying to do. 

You shook your thoughts out of your head and decided to distract yourself for the girls night you had planned instead. It wasn’t going to be a huge party, just your closest friends and few school and work friends having a good time. 

And no boys allowed. 

You had just finished putting all the alcohol and snacks away when you heard a knock at your door. You couldn’t help but smile, knowing it was most likely Steve. 

“How may I assist you?” You said as you swung the door open to reveal Steve standing there, huge grin on his lips. “Got any laundry detergent I could borrow?” He asked, cheeky smile never leaving his face. 

You crossed your arms over your chest and furrowed your eyebrows in confusion. “I thought you did laundry on Sunday’s” you thought aloud. “And today’s Friday.” You tried your best to stop the smile that was threatening to break out on your lips. 

“Alright, ya caught me,” Steve chuckled, putting his hands up to signal defeat. You snorted, turning on your heels to walk back towards your kitchen knowing that Steve would follow. “What do you really want, Rogers?” You asked, not even looking back at him. 

“What? I can’t hang out with my neighbour?” Steve said as convincingly as possible but you gave him that look that told him you saw right through him. “Fine,” he sighed, “just wanted to see if I could get an invite for tonight.” He smirked as he followed you through your apartment. 

“There’s a very strict no boys allowed policy,” you said, shrugging your shoulders. “Fine, but I’m taking you out for drinks soon, okay?” Steve said, pointing a finger at you until you agreed. 

“Whatever you say, Rogers.” You laughed as Steve left, leaving you feeling like you always did after talking to him. 

Flushed. 

Embarrassed. 

And slightly aroused. 

Steve was one of your closest friends, and he had been there for all the ups and downs in your relationship. He was also the first person who had raced over at three in the morning with ice cream and tissues to comfort you. 

You’d always thought that Steve was attractive, well, that was a given, but you’d always felt as if there was a connection with him. You loved him as a friend, but your heart always dropped a little when he mentioned his latest hookups or when you saw what pretty girl would be walking out of his place. 

But you couldn’t think about Steve anymore, it was almost party time and you had lots to do and very little time to do it in.

You didn’t know if it was the wine or the tequila, but you had ended up on the floor laughing as Wanda sat on the couch laughing with her head thrown back. It must’ve been about three in the morning and everyone else had left except her. 

“I think we need to discuss your dreamy neighbour, Shteve,” Wanda smirked as a blush tined your cheeks. “Oh you love him!” Wanda squealed as you furrowed your eyebrows “I do not,” you tried to say adamantly but Wanda saw right through you. 

“Oh so you wouldn’t mind him going out with someone tonight?” She smirked. “What, with who? Oh I bet it’s that pretty blonde on the third floor, I knew they had a thing for each other.” You grumbled only making Wanda laugh harder. 

“See.” She said matter-of-factly as you just rolled your eyes. “Okay fine, I like him.” You said as she just hummed. “Why won’t you just ask him out?” She said, grabbing a pillow and placing it on her lap as you made your way up onto the couch. 

You snorted at her words, “maybe because he doesn’t like me.” You said, raising an eyebrow only making Wanda roll her eyes at you. “He so does, I can see it.” She stated and this time it was your turn to roll your eyes. 

“Oh totally, let me just text him right now.” You giggled in your drunken state as Wanda snickered. You grabbed your phone for emphasis, pulling up Steve’s name in your phone. 

“Dear Steve,” you began as Wanda covered her mouth with her hand to hold her laughter back. “I think you’re cute and pretty and funny.” You continued, entertaining yourself. “Let’s go out on a date, maybe to the park or even a museum.” You added for theatrics as Wanda laughed. 

“Yours truly, your friendly neighbour [Y/N].” You finished off, throwing your hands up in victory. “Is that what you want me to do Wanda?” You asked as she just looked at you. 

“C’mon, it’s getting late, we should get to bed,” you said before shoving your phone in your back pocket forgetting it was even there as you and Wanda made your way to your room, fully expecting to be hungover in the morning. 

TAGLIST (OPEN): 

@nerdgirljen, @harryngtonewithyourshit, @just-in-case-iloveyou, @stevehesaidabadlanguageword, @cant-decide-at-this-moment, @srgntjbbarness, @aucontrerasv, @california-grown, @potteryourotter, @treacheroussparks 

Send me a message if you would like to be added/removed!

If you enjoy my work, consider buying me a coffee (:

blog.name: captainspy
blog.title: See you in a minute
blog.description: Who do you want me to be?
